sentences.en: Approximately half a million visitors go to Pompeii each year.
sentences.cn: 每年都有约五十万名的观光客到庞贝参观.

sentences.en: Behind the city of Pompeii stood the 4000 - feet Mount Vesuvius.
sentences.cn: 庞培城的后面矗立着4000英尺高的维苏维火山.

sentences.en: Mount Nyiragongo is one of the most dangerous volcanoes in the world - and scientists say it is only a matter of time before it makes the city below a modern day Pompeii.
sentences.cn: 尼拉贡戈火山是世界上最危险的火山之一，科学家表示，山脚下的城镇重现庞培古城的悲剧只是时间的问题。

sentences.en: Pompeii is no longer a buried city.
Pompeii was a cultural center and vacation destination for Roman high society until it was destroyed in 79 A.D. by the eruption of Mount Vesuvius.
sentences.cn: 公元79年维苏威火山爆发并摧毁该城市以前，意大利古城庞培一直是罗马帝国上流社会贵族们的度假天堂，也是罗马帝国的文化中心。

sentences.en: Pompeii was overwhelmed by a vast accumulation of dust and ashes.
sentences.cn: 庞贝湮没在一巨大的尘土和灰烬堆里.

sentences.en: Pompeii's graffiti includes insults, love declarations, and political satire.

sentences.en: So in 1860, the Italian archaeologist Giuseppe Fiorelli was made director of the Pompeii dig.
sentences.cn: 于是,1860年意大利考古学家朱赛佩·奥雷利受命担任了庞贝古城遗址发掘工作的总指挥.

sentences.en: The people of Pompeii now knew that doom at hand.
sentences.cn: 现在,庞贝城的人民知道厄运即将降临了.
